definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: We insist on regarding them as they are aged and weak.
sentences.chinese: 自己们强行把他们认作是垂老地，弱势地。

sentences.english: An old physician, and a young lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 医生垂老的好，律师年老的俏。

sentences.english: Decades have passed and you'renow old and retired from adventuring.
sentences.chinese: 几十年过去，你垂垂老矣，冒险生涯已成昨天。

sentences.english: Noboday grows old merely by a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals.
sentences.chinese: 年岁有加，并非垂老，理想丢弃，方随暮年。

sentences.english: 2a flash of God, a twinkling of an eye, so we vertical chuilao.
sentences.chinese: 一晃神，一转眼，我们就这样垂垂老去。

sentences.english: Nobody grows old merely by a number of years . We grow old by deserting our ideals.
sentences.chinese: 年岁有加，并非垂老，理想德育，方至暮年。

definition: one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave
white head of hair/fig. old person
